ReasonsToReject.Description: The paper does not present new findings, insights, or methods.
The research methods used are unsound or inadequately described.
The central research question or hypothesis is vague or unclear.
There is not enough data to support the conclusions.
The analysis may contain errors or inappropriate statistical tests.
The paper does not reference or discuss key works in the field.
The paper is disorganized or lacks clarity.
The paper has numerous grammatical or syntax errors.
The conclusions aren't fully supported by the data or analysis.
The paper has problems related to ethical considerations.
The results section does not adequately address the research question.
The paper is not grounded in a clear theoretical or conceptual framework.
The paper does not align with the scope or theme of the journal.
There are inappropriate or missing citations.
The paper does not provide enough detail for replication.

ReasonsToAccept.Description: The paper introduces a new concept, finding, or perspective.
The research methods are sound and clearly described.
The paper articulates a well-defined and relevant research question.
The paper provides sufficient, relevant data.
The analysis is done correctly, using appropriate methods.
The paper acknowledges and effectively builds upon existing research.
The paper follows a clear structure and is easy to follow.
The language is clear, concise, and free from errors.
The research adheres to ethical guidelines.
The results are meaningful and contribute to the field.
The research is grounded in a robust theoretical framework.
The paper fits well with the scope and theme of the journal.
The paper appropriately cites all sources.
The research can be replicated or built upon by other scholars.
